Class Reservoir

  • java.lang.Object
    • Reservoir

  • public class Reservoir
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements a sparsely connected reservoir of N rate-model neurons. Connection weights are sparse and drawn from a normal distribution; they are represented by a 2D matrix (JBlas library) and scaled by g/sqrt(N*p) (Sussillo & Abbott 2009, p. 556). Activity is represented as a 1D matrix of firing rates.

    Dynamics are those of a leaky integrator. Feedback into the network is optionally provided by a Streams.Feedback object. Input is optionally provided by a Streams.Input object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Reservoir

        public Reservoir(int N,
         double p,
         double g,
         double tau,
         double dt)
        Initialize a network of N neurons with integration step size dt and with small, random initial activity.
        Parameters:
        N - the number of neurons
        p - the probability of a pairwise connection (sparsity parameter)
        g - weighting factor for connectivity
        tau - the time constant of the neurons
        dt - the integration time step
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if N is less than one
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if p is not between 0 and 1
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if g or dt is infinite or NaN
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tau is nonpositive, infinite, or NaN

      • Reservoir

        public Reservoir()
        Initialize a network with default parameters: N = 1000; p = 0.1; g = 1.5; tau = 0.01; dt = 0.001
